intro: Psydrax dicoccos, commonly known as the African peach or wild peach, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
